In the field of business administration, marketing involves promoting and selling products or services, including market research and advertising. Finance deals with the management of money and includes activities like investing, borrowing, lending, budgeting, saving, and forecasting. Organizational behavior, on the other hand, studies how individuals and groups behave within an organization and how this behavior affects the performance of the organization. Which of these fields is primarily concerned with the study of human behavior within a business organization?
A. Marketing
B. Finance
C. Organizational Behavior
D. None of the above

C. Organizational Behavior
Organizational behavior is the field that primarily focuses on studying human behavior within a business organization. It examines how individuals and groups act and interact within organizational settings and how these behaviors impact the overall performance and effectiveness of the organization. This field combines aspects of psychology, sociology, and anthropology to understand and improve workplace dynamics.

Marketing, on the other hand, is mainly concerned with promoting and selling products or services, which includes activities like market research and advertising. Finance deals with the management of money, including investing, borrowing, lending, budgeting, saving, and forecasting. While both marketing and finance are crucial components of business administration, they do not primarily focus on the study of human behavior within organizations like organizational behavior does.
